column2: COLORADO DMV PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. You may not pass another vehicle on either side of a _______ centerline.
2. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: stop doing what they are doing.
column6: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column8: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column10: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.

column2: 3. As you approach an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow. You should:
column4: apply the brakes sharply and come to a complete stop.
column6: be prepared to stop before the intersection.
column8: be prepared to stop in the middle of the intersection.
column10: speed up to beat the red light.

column2: 4. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: use the vehicle ahead as your only points of focus.
column8: keep one hand on the steering wheel.

column2: 5. This road sign warns drivers that:
column6: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column10: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.

column2: 6. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column8: go back and wait the “WALK” light

column2: 7. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.
column6: only if you have an emergency.
column8: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.
column10: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.

column2: 8. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column8: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.

column2: 9. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.
column6: enter the right lane. When traffic permits, you can move out of the left lane.
column8: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.
column10: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.

column2: 10. This sign means:
column10: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 11. Drivers under 21 years of age are considered to be driving under the influence if their blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is:
12. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.

column2: 13. Drivers may pass another vehicle if the line dividing two lanes is a ________ line.
14. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: left and right turns are not allowed.
column8: they must stop at the next intersection.

column2: 15. A red traffic sign means?
16. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column6: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.
column8: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.

column2: 17. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column4: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.
column6: wait until the crossing gates are completely up.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
19. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
column6: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.

column2: 20. This sign means:
21. At night, it is hardest to see:
22. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who have traditional work schedules.
column6: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.

column2: 23. Your first response to reduced visibility should be:
column6: to turn on your windshield wipers.
column10: to look for road edge markings to guide you.

column2: 24. When parked facing down hill, your wheels should be turned:
25. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column8: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.
